content.question: Peru’s commercial anchovy industry would most likely be harmed during an El Niño Southern Oscillation (ENSO) event. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for the decline in anchovy during an El Niño Southern Oscillation (ENSO) event?

choices.label: Acidic ocean waters kill off larval anchovies.
Less nutrient-rich water reaches surface waters, disrupting the food web.
Ocean currents move toxic contaminants from the sediments into the water column.
An increase in phosphate-based nutrients leads to an algal bloom, which would decrease available oxygen for animals like shrimp.

content.answer: Less nutrient-rich water reaches surface waters, disrupting the food web.
